description.narrative: This award strives to help nations effectively establish the conditions and capacity for achieving peace, security, and stability. More specifically, this includes This course is part one of a two-part requirement to be certified as a PME instructor. Part two consists of a 5-week Inter-European Officer Practicum Instructor Course (IE-OPIC) course, focused on practical application of principles learned in this course. The IE-OIC course consists of a two-week Theories and Principles of Adult Education (TPAE) course adapted from Squadron Officer College at Maxwell AFB, Alabama. TPAE prepares students to apply various instructional methods to deliver curriculum in adult education environments. Curriculum delivery is focused on achieving higher levels of learning through deliberate application of instructor skill sets. The course focuses on effective teaching techniques, including classroom management, feedback/assessment, and the integration of technology. Instructional methods taught in the course include lectures, guided discussions, case studies, gamification and experiential learning. All classes are developed using established educational theory, to which the students are also exposed. The course includes practical application and focuses on developing instructors through mentorship and actionable feedback. Graduates will be able to: apply effective techniques to accomplish learning objectives (alignment of course objectives, teaching, and assessment methods); apply effective communication and management skills inherent in a classroom environment; demonstrate various instructional delivery methods; differentiate between productive and nonproductive student behavior; assess student comprehension and application; apply appropriate motivational measures; analyze student learning and development; identify impromptu learning opportunities; and master integrated technology applications..

To help nations effectively establish the conditions and capacity for achieving peace, security, and stability; and for responding effectively against arising threats to national or international security and stability.
